title.native: ぼくたちは勉強ができない！

description:
To get a scholarship, Nariyuki becomes a reluctant tutor to three unteachable girls. He must quickly make an art-lover adore mathematics, turn a literary genius into a bonafide scientist, and transform a top-tier athlete into a passing student.

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: Boku-tachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai 2nd Season
เรื่องนี้ตําราไม่มีสอน ภาค 2

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description: __Website | Twitter | Instagram | YouTube__ Introduction: Halca is a Japanese musician affiliated with company Music Ray'n and signed to label Sacra Music. She had a major appearance as the opening act during the CHiCO with HoneyWorks 2017 tour. In 2018 she released her first single called "Kimi no Tonari", which was used as the ending theme for the anime "Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku". Her other appearances have been in anime such as: Ace Attorney, Kaguya-sama: Love is War and We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2 Biography: Halca started with an interest in music from early childhood. She was heavily inspired when she one day received a copy of the song "Again" by YUI. While in junior high school, she discovered that her home's cable TV had an anime channel, which is also the way she became familiar with anime music in general. She would watch this anime channel on a daily basis, which slowly began to impact her future plans. The biggest impact from the several anime shows she watched in her childhood, were shows such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Toradora!. The anime that had the biggest musical influence ended up being the song "Kiss Kara Hajimaru Miracle" from the anime Steel Angel Kurumi, which became her favorite anime song. She decided to join her school's choir club and broadcast theater club later on to hone her vocal skills, as she started to take an approach to singing herself. After honing her skills in school she officially decided to pursue a career as a musician. Halca had a lot of singing auditions to consider, but the audition that piqued her interest the most was for the Utakatsu! Audition, which focused on anime songs. She decided to participate in the audition for Utakatsu!, and she ended up winning the grand prize in 2013. She didn't let win go to her head, however, as after the winning the audition she continued to train her vocal skills while waiting to make her major debut. In 2017 she was invited by the singer CHiCO, known primarily for her involvement in the group HoneyWorks (alongside Gom, Shito and Yamako), to perform in the latter's 2017 live tour as their opening act. Following her opening act, she performed the song "Kimi no Sora" ("Your Sky"), which was included in a compilation album released to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the online novel publisher Noichigo. She also performed with the song "Resonator", which was used in the original soundtrack for the anime series "Beatless", and she also made a mini-album titled White Disc, which was sold during the HoneyWorks tour. Halca made her major debut later in 2018, with the release of her first single "Kimi no Tonari" ("Next to You"), which was used as the ending theme for the anime Wotakoi: Love is Hard for Otaku. To commemorate the release of her first single, the mini-album White Disc was made available for sale during the single's release event. Her second single "Starting Blue" was released in October 2018, with the title track being used as the ending theme for the second season of the anime Ace Attorney. Her third single "Sentimental Crisis" was released in February 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme for the anime Kaguya-sama: Love is War. Her fourth single "Houkago no Liberty" was released on November 13, 2019, the title track was used as the ending theme to the anime We Never Learn!: BOKUBEN Season 2. (Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halca), edited)
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Originally from Anime Roman together with [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/), [Shingo Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/105132/) and [Hiroshi Ookubo](https://anilist.co/staff/105135/).

After graduating from Kanagawa Prefectural Yokosuka High School she began working for Telecom Film. In the later half of the 90s she worked often together with Daichi Akitarou, overseeing much of the work in his stead. She made her debut as director on Sister Princess RePure. One year later she directed Da Capo, where she was able to introduce even more of her own ideas and display her creative vision.

Website Collaboration Study is a seiyuu collaboration that was made for the anime Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai, which features Haruka Shiraishi, Sayumi Suzushiro and Miyu Tomita (as Fumino Furuhashi, Uruka Takemoto and Rizu Ogata respectively). They performed with the song "Seishun Seminar" as the opening theme, while also performing "Never Give It Up!!" as the ending theme. The collaboration performed once again for the second season of Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai, reasonably titled Bokutachi wa Benkyou ga Dekinai 2, but this time Lynn and Madoka Asahina were added to the line-up. Lynn features Mafuyu Kirisu in the show, while Madoka Asahina feature as Asumi Kominami. In this season of the show they performed the song "Can Now, Can Now" which aired as the opening theme, while the ending theme was performed by halca. (Source: boku-ben.com)

__[Website](http://sonodakentaro.com/)__ Birthplace: Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan Instrument(s): vocal, guitar, bass and drums __Sonoda Kentarou__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, singer and songwriter.
